= Introduction =

[http://mono-project.com/What_is_Mono Mono is a multi-platform CLR/.NET implementation] written and maintained by [http://www.novell.com/ Novell].

It makes it possible to run .NET programs on Linux, MacOS X and other unices.

A very cool feature of Mono is its [http://www.mono-project.com/Embedding_Mono Embedding C API], which is an ideal target for use from Java using [http://jnaerator.googlecode.com/ JNAerated] wrappers.

= Downloads =

You can download [http://nativelibs4java.sourceforge.net/maven/com/nativelibs4java/mono4java/ Mono4Java Maven artifacts from here], or use it from a Maven project with the following dependency :
{{{
<project>
  ...
  <repositories>
    ...
    <repository>
      <id>nativelibs4java</id>
      <name>nativelibs4java Maven2 Repository</name>
      <url>http://nativelibs4java.sourceforge.net/maven</url>
    </repository>
  </repositories>

  <dependencies>
    <dependency>
      <groupId>com.nativelibs4java</groupId>
      <artifactId>mono4java</artifactId>
      <version>0.1-SNAPSHOT</version>
    </dependency>
  </dependencies>
  ...
</project>
}}}

= Quickstart =

Read this blog entry [http://ochafik.free.fr/blog/?p=165 .NET WinForms HelloWorld from Java using embedded Mono + JNAerator].

It explains how to use the [http://code.google.com/p/nativelibs4java/source/browse/#svn/trunk/libraries/Mono/examples examples].

= Building =

See the [Build] page. After a full build of all of NativeLibs4Java's source tree, Mono4Java's artifacts are in `libraries/Mono/Mono4Java/target`.

The bindings can be re-generated with `mvn jnaerator:jnaerate` in the Mono4Java directory.
